column3: tested ACK. Out of interest, was this causing issues?\n\nMinor suggestion: you've used the str.format() method here, and the line immediately below uses a C-style string specifier for the same variable. Perhaps use the same syntax for both? (I don't care which)

> was this causing issues

Yes, when running the tests with a binary of different name, such as
`bitcoin-qt`. See #7209 or try `BITCOIND=bitcoin-qt
./qa/pull-tester/rpc-tests.py`.

re style nit: Personally I think the new style format method looks nicer, but I think everyone is free to use whatever they prefer as long as changes only happen when the code is touched anyway. (No "qa: Unify format methods" pulls please)
